page.title: 19TOURISM
page.content: Heart of Kent Tour This comprises a series of signposts depicting a white horse directing motorists on a tour of the Heart of Kent and is supported by leaflets available from Tourist Information Centres Public House Brenchley,The Half-Way House, Isle of Wight,derives its name from the fact that it stands on an island made by the roads surrounding it which resembles the shape of the Isle of Wight off the Hampshire Coast Castle Hill Picnic Area This area has table and chairs for picnicing and provides visitors to the area with an extensive view over the Weald of Kent and beyond on a clear day Many foreigners visit Kent
